question: What is the basis of the BLISS technique?
ideal_answer: Here we present Breaks Labeling In Situ and Sequencing (BLISS), a versatile and quantitative method for genome-wide profiling of DNA double-strand breaks.

snippets.text: BLISS is a versatile and quantitative method for genome-wide profiling of DNA double-strand breaks.

Breaks Labeling In Situ and Sequencing (BLISS), featuring the following: (1) direct labelling of DSBs in fixed cells or tissue sections on a solid surface; (2) low-input requirement by linear amplification of tagged DSBs by in vitro transcription; (3) quantification of DSBs through unique molecular identifiers; and (4) easy scalability and multiplexing.
Recently, we have further expanded the quantitative nature, applicability, and scalability of BLESS by developing Breaks Labeling In Situ and Sequencing (BLISS)
